whatWhy.title: What and Why?
paragraphs: The purpose of this site is to present what I like to do, and it was created out of the necessity of showing off my work and my aptitudes since they fall out of what my academic formation demonstrates. It's a compendium of activities and projects solely related to software development. Everything was made (or is going to be made), following these principles: accessibility, design, performance, tech. The source code of this site is open source and it's freely available on Github under the MIT license. You can get it through my [GitHub profile](https://github.com/danieluy).

design.title: Design
paragraphs: I'm a software developer but I love design, and I do not adhere to the separation of these two concepts. I believe that no product should be without proper design. I cannot call myself a designer, I have too much respect for design to do so, but I love to make my attempts on designing stuff, or at least implement design guidelines that I'm fond of.

I would like to expose the intention of my design for this website, and it's actually a simple one: achieve an aesthetically pleasing design putting accessibility first. The way I attempted to achieve that goal is more complicated, but is not something I want to discuss here.

A big part of the pleasing sight of this site are the amazing illustrations used to accompany these words, and I would like to thank [unDraw](https://undraw.co/) for making all that open source content available to us.
